Class XmlUtils

java.lang.Object
  propel.core.utils.XmlUtils

public final class XmlUtils
extends java.lang.Object

Provides utility functionality for parsing XML nodes/attributes

Method Detail

compact

public static java.lang.String compact(java.lang.String xml)
Compacts an XML text string, by removing CR, LF, TAB and double WHITESPACE characters. Be aware that this method does not preserve CDATA content.

Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - An argument is null.

findAttribute

public static org.w3c.dom.Node findAttribute(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                             java.lang.String attributeName)
Searches for the first matching attribute found on the given Node. Uses StringMatch.Equals and OrdinalIgnoreCase string comparison. If none is found, null is returned.

Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - An argument is null.

findNode

public static org.w3c.dom.Node findNode(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                        java.lang.String childNodeName)
Searches for a matching child node found under the given Node. Uses StringMatch.Equals and OrdinalIgnoreCase string comparison. Returns the first node found or, if no node is found, null.

Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - When an argument is null.

findNode

public static org.w3c.dom.Node findNode(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                        java.lang.String childNodeName,
                                        int index)
Searches for a matching child node found under the given Node. Use 0 for index to indicate that the first node found is to be returned, 1 for second, etc. Uses StringMatch.Equals and OrdinalIgnoreCase string comparison. If none is found or the index is not reached, null is returned.

Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - When an argument is null.

findNode

public static org.w3c.dom.Node findNode(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                        java.lang.String childNodeName,
                                        int index,
                                        MatchType matchType,
                                        StringComparison comparisonType)
Searches for a matching child node found under the given Node. By default the first node found is returned, but this is configurable. If none is found, null is returned.

Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - When an argument is null.

findAllNodes

public static java.util.List<org.w3c.dom.Node> findAllNodes(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                                            java.lang.String childNodeName)
Searches for all matching child nodes found under the given Node. Uses StringMatch.Equals and OrdinalIgnoreCase string comparison. If none is found, an empty list is returned.

Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - An argument is null.

findAllNodes

public static java.util.List<org.w3c.dom.Node> findAllNodes(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                                            java.lang.String childNodeName,
                                                            MatchType matchType,
                                                            StringComparison comparisonType)
Searches for all matching child nodes found under the given Node. If none is found, an empty list is returned.

Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - An argument is null.

parseNode

public static java.lang.String parseNode(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                         java.lang.String childNodeName)
Parses a child node found on the given Node. Uses StringMatch.Equals and OrdinalIgnoreCase string comparison. Returns the first node found or, if no node is found, null.

Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - When an argument is null.

parseNode

public static java.lang.String parseNode(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                         java.lang.String childNodeName,
                                         int index)
Parses a child node found on the given Node. Use 0 for index to indicate that the first node found is to be parsed, 1 for second, etc. Uses StringMatch.Equals and OrdinalIgnoreCase string comparison. If none is found or the index is not reached, null is returned.

Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - When an argument is null.

parseNode

                                         java.lang.String childNodeName,
                                         int index,
                                         MatchType matchType,
                                         StringComparison comparisonType)
Parses a child node found on the given Node. Use 0 for index to indicate that the first node found is to be parsed, 1 for second, etc. If none is found or the index is not reached, null is returned.

Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - When an argument is null.
